page.title: 11My Village, Curry Rivel
page.content: In Curry Rivel there are a lot of things to do, like Brownies, Cubs, Dancing Classes and on Sundays in the Church there is a choir. I like the Carnival that we have every year, when people dress up as monkeys and cows because they look very funny. In Curry Rivel there are only a few shops. There is a vegetable and fruit shop, a food shop, a Post Office, a basket making shop and some garages. I live at Stoney Hurst Drive and altogether there are about twenty houses. I like my street because some of my friends live there and it is not busy for us to play on and we can ride our bikes up and down. My dad works at Westlands and sometimes he flies the helicopters. My mum works hard looking after us; my sister aged 6 and my brother aged 2 and myself aged 9.
